name: Buttermilk Falls Inn & Spa

reviews.text: First and foremost, we liked the grounds quite a bit, but the staff and service hardly made the exorbitant prices in upstate NY worth it. We overheard many inappropriate and disgusting comments made by staff members whom either didn't realize, or didn't care that guests were present. The food was ok. Our bed was extremely uncomfortable and you could hear other guests easily through the walls, doors and floors. Our gas fireplace although initially enticing almost sweated us out of the room to the point where we couldn't use it at all. The spa was nice enough although there is only one bathroom, one shower, and no space in the locker room. Our massages were very good. The pool was too cold and the sauna not hot enough. Overall disappointing.
reviews.title: Poor Service, beautiful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was a beautiful spread of various sliced fresh fruits, fruit juices, organic yogurt, pastries, and various cereals and breads. I enjoyed the daily hot fruit compote set out to be used as a topping for your breakfast foods. In addition to this continental fare, the inn offers a hot breakfast made to order each day. The fluffy waffles I had one morning, topped with wild berries and caramelized pecans, were a delicious and memorable start to my day. I traveled to the Hudson River Valley to dine at the Culinary Institute of America and Blue Hill at Stone Barn, and I have to say that the lovely cake served at tea time at Buttermilk Falls Inn was one of the best o the trip!
reviews.title: A perfect, quiet oasis to relax & soak in natural beauty
Not quite luxury, a few missed notes but worth a visit...
reviews.text: The rooms are decorated and furnished in a comfortable elegance. The whirlpool bath in my room was vigorously rejuvenating. I also took advantage of the spa, which is open to hotel guests. It's a retreat in itself. Newly built, the interior is a soothing space of bamboo and other natural materials. One side is glass, so as I swam in the indoor pool heated to a wonderful warm temperature, I could gaze out over a beautiful meadow.

I went in the fall and enjoyed the various walking paths through the woods and hills of the property to take in nature's magnificent display of color. The view of the river valley from the property's outlook is wonderful. It rained one day, but the inn has a cozy library where you can curl up with a good book on days like that.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss

reviews.text: There was an inexplicable white noise outside our room that ran 24-hours. And, during my 5-day stay, the lock on our door was never fixed, though we alerted them shortly after check-in. I tried making small talk one evening with the manager, but he didn't seem that interested or open to it. But, I was so relaxed and happy from all the other elements of my stay that i still loved it overall.
reviews.title: A real find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have wanted to visit the inn and spa for ages and having little kids just never got the right opportunity. Finally, the time was ours. We managed one night away and have already booked our second two night stay for December. Both the Inn and Spa are nothing short of heavenly, indulgent, peaceful, serene, tranquil, and blissful. We felt transported to an alternate universe for the weekend. It was far more than we could have imagined or dreamed of. It's low key, low-stress, and just AWESOME. You will feel spoiled from the moment you enter the magnificient grounds until the sad moment you have to leave. The staff are so nice. The grounds are immaculate, the coffee is even great. Nothing bad to say about this gem!!!!
reviews.title: a little piece of nirvana on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Buttermilk on our honeymoon and could not have been happier with our stay. We felt spoiled the entire time we were there. The food was excellent (Thanksgiving dinner too!) and our accommodations were great. We loved walking the beautiful grounds. The staff was incredibly helpful and went out of their way to pamper us. While setting up reservations for us at a local restaurant, they secretly informed the place that we were newlyweds and we were surprised with a champagne toast and special service when we arrived. Not only that, they even surprised us on our return with champagne in the room! We simply could not say enough glorious things about the Inn and hope to return again in a couple of months.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!! Cannot wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn and surrounding grounds are quite lovely. The inn sits atop a small hill overlooking the Hudson (but you can't really see the river when the leaves are on the trees). The grounds are beautifully maintained and include a small pond, farm (chickens and llamas), and a path down to a small waterfall. Apparently, all the farming is organic - some of the fruits and veggies make it into the morning breakfast.
reviews.title: Beautiful inn, very uncomfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn itself is very nicely decorated and the rooms with balconies and/or patios have very nice views. We stayed in the Winterberry Room which has a sporadically working fireplace (quite cold when the a/c is running for the whole building) and a nice bathroom with soaking tub and shower. Unfortunately, there is hardly any light in the room, making it very difficult to read in bed. The bed itself was terrible - we woke up every morning feeling unrested - defeating the purpose of a relaxing weekend. We've slept better in much less expensive accommodations.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem with Breathtaking View and Lush Grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served daily and includes a nice selection of fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal and toasts/bagels in addition to made-to-order eggs. The inn staff was young and friendly and had suggestions for local restaurants (we recommend Racoon Saloon for a nice, casual dinner - great burgers!).
reviews.title: Great Find & Perfect Location for Exploring the Hudson Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Inn twice and "hosted" a bridal shower at the spa for my best friend and each time was a great experience. Most recently, my fiance booked a weekend stay at the Inn for my birthday and when he told me (after he booked Rook's Nest), I was slightly bummed because I had received a coupon for 35% off by email the day before he made reservations. I told him to call back and see if the Inn would let us use the coupon and he was very skeptical (especially since the coupon specifically stated that the coupon was for "new" reservations only) and was amazed when they cheerily said "no problem" and applied the coupon. Who does that??! I recommend the hot stone facial (my favorite) at the spa. Guests at the Inn can use the pool, sauna, and steam room for free. Our room was cozy, clean, and well-stocked with organic sodas, granola bars, and treats. The shower in the bathroom was awesome (under an enormous skylight)! The staff were uniformly helpful and the breakfasts were fantastic. A wide range of items (oatmeal, toast, bagels, lox and cream cheese, cereals, granola bars, muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, two hot dishes (pancakes and bacon, frittata and sausage, etc.), coffees and teas, juices, etc. are available at breakfast and there's plenty of food. The Hudson Baking Company is a good alternative (about 5-10 minutes away) if you want to go out and the cute town of New Paltz is only 15-20 minutes away- This place is perfect if you are looking for peace and quiet and relaxation in a low-key but beautiful setting.
reviews.title: Multiple visits...I love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband surprised me with a weekend at the Buttermilk Falls Inn and Spa for my birthday. Everything was absolutely wonderful. The grounds are gorgeous, from the llama pen, to the albino peacock, to the two ponds filled with koi, to the swans and geese, to the falls themselves and the short hike down to the hudson. We stayed in the Juniper Room - great bed, electric fireplace, jacuzzi and large balcony overlooking the gorgeous grounds. Romantic...luxurious...cozy.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful - A perfect weekend in the Hudson Valley
Mixed Feelings- Beautiful Property yet some Quirks...
reviews.text: The spa is absolutely lovely. A modern addition to the traditional grounds, it is a glass enclosed cube filled with a sauna, steam room and "endless" pool. We both had fantastic massages, and when we weren't in the steam room we sat and watched the trees, the birds, the hudson....

reviews.title: Never responded to emails
reviews.text: And wonderful as the room, grounds and spa were, the best part may have been the staff. On our first day there daily tea consisted of a quiche (looked great- didn't try it) wonderful home made chocolate chip cookies, and the best apple pie my husband had ever had. We mentioned to our wonderful inn keeper CJ how much he loved the pie, and sunday- despite the fact that we were the only guests staying that night - we came home from the spa to discover an apple pie waiting just for us, complete with two forks. And later that night as we headed out to Beso in New Paltz for dinner (incredible)- Innkeeper Bernadette handed us directions to the restaurant that she had personally typed out for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough about how fantastic our weekend was. Buttermilk Falls exceeded all of our expectations. An absolutely perfect weekend.
reviews.title: We'll Be Back!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in the Grand Laurel Suite - a very large and very comfortable room. Every room in the Inn has a fireplace, modern amenities, and beautiful decor - just lovely. Our room had a large jacuzzi tub which was more "modern" than many jacuzzi tubs you find at B&B's - I used it more than once! Our room was quiet and peaceful, and I found time to curl up in front of the fireplace with a book, which was wonderful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Buttermilk Falls Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are HUGE and beautiful - we enjoyed walking around and finding the gardens, the chickens, the ducks, the Falls, and all the lovely spots. The gardening staff was busy but unobtrusive, letting us just take our time to enjoy the fragrant flowers and trees which were everywhere.
reviews.title: Truly Amazing

reviews.text: We did not get to have breakfast beyond a crossant - unfortunately we had to leave and I forgot to tell the front desk that we would like breakfast earlier, something which I know they would have done had we asked. My fault! The review that says the breakfast was small is just mistaken, I saw the food and there was an AMAZING spread of continental items as well as omelettes and sausages...and as much as you care to eat. As far as other dining goes, New Paltz is quite close and has some great restaurants, as well as the Culinary Institute of America in Poughkeepsie is nearby - we went to both areas and had wonderful meals.
reviews.title: Pretty Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not use the spa but it looked lovely - perhaps next time.
reviews.title: Restful retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few notes that I think other travelers would want to know:
reviews.title: Terrific Spot

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet, beautiful rooms and grounds

description: Located on 75 acres overlooking the Hudson River. Cascading waterfalls, swan ponds, organic gardens, fresh gourmet breakfasts, eco-friendly spa with pool, sauna and steam room. Rooms with private fireplaces, whirlpool tubs, and balconies.
